page.title: 12THE WILTSHIRE RIVER TILL
page.content: The river Till rises from springs upstream at Tilshead. It flows through Orcheston, Shrewton then meanders through the meadows to Winterbourne Stoke and on to Berwick St James to join with the Wylye at Stapleford. This 'winterbourne' got its name from the upper reaches of the chalk streams which dry up during the Summer months, and the springs start to bubble and seep up into the dry courses during November and December, and the brooks are at their highest level in February The level though, does depend on the rainfall during the previous Summer and Autumn. All the streams of Salisbury Plain are crystal clear, and even when one flows past a muddy farmyard, it purifies itself quite quickly. Cattle are often seen drinking from it and moorhens and ducks nest regularly along its banks.
